qas.question: What religion is dominant in the countries surrounding Armenia?
Who became Catholicos in Etchmiadzin in 1441?
How do the two Catholicosates compare?
What did the Armenian Muslims have close ties to?
What other religion has been surrounded by a Christian majority?
How do Muslims in Armenia view Hamshenis?
How long have Christians been involved in Eurpean Crusader States?
Since the existence of Eurppean Crusaider States, what has there been in the Hamshenis Church?

context: The Armenians collective has, at times, constituted a Christian "island" in a mostly <a0_0><b6_0>Muslim<b6_0/><a0_0/> region. There is, however, a minority of <a1_0>ethnic Armenian Muslims<a1_0/>, known as Hamshenis but many Armenians view them <b7_0>as a separate race<b7_0/>, while the history of the Jews in Armenia dates back <b8_0>2,000 years<b8_0/>. The Armenian Kingdom of Cilicia had close ties to <b5_0>European Crusader States<b5_0/>. Later on, the deteriorating situation in the region led the bishops of Armenia to elect a Catholicos in Etchmiadzin, the original seat of the Catholicosate. In 1441, a new Catholicos was elected in Etchmiadzin in the person of <a2_0>Kirakos Virapetsi<a2_0/>, while <a3_0>Krikor Moussapegiants<a3_0/> preserved his title as Catholicos of Cilicia. Therefore, since 1441, there have been <b9_0>two Catholicosates<b9_0/> in the Armenian Church with <a4_0>equal rights and privileges<a4_0/>, and with their respective jurisdictions. The primacy of honor of the Catholicosate of Etchmiadzin has always been recognized by the Catholicosate of Cilicia.
